title: Release 0.18.0
body:
The change bumps the version to `0.18.0` and exposes `sync_max_get_header` and `sync_max_get_txns` in the helm chart.

# Release 0.18.0

## Overview

A new release brings:
- Optimization for the execution based on the performance from beta 3 and on internal benchmarks. Improved metrics gathering.
- Stabilization and better test coverage of the `fuel-vm`. We removed almost all unsafe code and added test cases for each opcode. Fixed some edge cases with memory in the `fuel-vm`.
- Fully integrated Merkle trees and filled all malleable fields in the transactions.
- Added retryable messages, removed redundant fields from it, and updated the API to support a new commitment schema.

## What's Changed

### Breaking

- All unsafe functions were replaced with safe analog in the `fuel-crypto` - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/346
- `$hp` holds the address of the last available byte in a heap, while previously it was `$hp - 1` - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/377
- Each variant in the `fuel_tx::Input` enum now has its own type - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/364
- Message nonce is unified and now `Bytes32` everywhere - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/394
- Removed the `message_id` field from all places - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/397, https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/373, 
- Unified the block height in all places with the introduction of a new `BlockHeigh` - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/410
- Make SMO instruction take data ptr as an argument -  https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/404
- Now the chain id affects the signature and predicate's owner and should be passed into the `sign` function - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/406
- Updated the `produce_blocks` endpoint to accept the start time and the number of blocks. All new blocks will use the previous timestamp as a base - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1059
- The `fuel-core` stores only unspent coins and messages, so all API that previously returned spent coins is affected - Prune owned coin idx when inputs are spent by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1055
- The message proof API has been changed to be compatible with a new version - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1071
- The `fuel-core` now has retryable messages and coin messages. Retryable messages can only be consumed during successful transaction execution. The coin message acts as common coins. `resouces_to_spend` API was replaced with `coins_to_spend` that returns a new `CoinType` type. - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1067

## All changes
* adding fuel-core service monitor to helm chart by @rfuelsh in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1037
* Adding specific app selector  by @rfuelsh in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1039
* use sticky sessions for GQL requests to sentries by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1042
* Add ingress service name to helm chart by @rfuelsh in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1043
* Added test to verify the iteration over owned transactions by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1041
* Change sentry lb to use clusterIP by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1045
* Fixed Tempfile dependency by @ControlCplusControlV in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1048
* Write contract code in raw by @freesig in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/994
* attempt to use buildjet runners by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1017
* Set tx pointer during block production by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1054
* Used `BASE_AMOUNT` for test with bob to pay for fee by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1057
* Prepare GraphQL Crate for extraction by @ControlCplusControlV in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1012
* Support large contract deployments over p2p by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1062
* fix yaml and add linting job by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1063
* Actualized the ABI for message to be compatible with last version of the Solidity contracts. by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1060
* feat: Contract state and assets merkle data storage by @bvrooman in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1008
* Take into account the previous block timestamp during block production by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1059
* Prune owned coin idx when inputs are spent by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1055
* Retrayable messages fuel-core part by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1067
* chore: Additional Tests for Contract States and Balances by @bvrooman in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1073
* Rust 1.68.1 & Sparse Registry by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1077
* Nginx tuneup by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1080
* chore: Update balance and state Merkleization by @bvrooman in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1084
* Support sticky session in the client by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1079
* Added e2e test to run 1000 `dry_run` by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1091
* Use docker.io auth credentials to overcome rate limiting by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1092
* honeycomb tracing subscription by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1083
* Update withdrawal proof API to support proving from a block header committed to L1 by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1071
* Upstream v0.17.8 by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1102
* use chainid for transactions and predicates by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1107
* fix the dry-run e2e test to actually perform dry runs by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1111
* peer reputation with separate app & gossipsub score by @leviathanbeak in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1028
* Adding sentry data synchronization by @rfuelsh in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1115
* Capture metrics for graphql api by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1113
* Update cargo audit and add to commit by @freesig in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1152
* add task params by @leviathanbeak in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1159
* Took into account that block creation could take some time by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1162
* Applying optimizations from `0.17.11` release by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1158


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/compare/v0.17.3...v0.18.0

title: Took into account that block creation could take some time
body: Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/966

title: add task params
body: Adding optional Task parameters when initializing `Task:RunnableTask` from `RunnableService`.

title: Applying optimizations from `0.17.11` release
body:
Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1137

The PR duplicates most of the changes from the https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1157 but for the `master` branch.
It adds two e2e tests, but they fail because of new changes in the `fuel-vm`(the change to the `PC` register). It is not critical, but replacing them with the correct scripts later would be nice.
- One test uploads the contract with a huge large state and executes it. The test takes a lot of time to execute and highlights that we have performance problems with the state calculation: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1143
- Another test is more of a base for spamming the testnets. We can put any hex-encoded transaction and dry run it on the network. It contains a simple transfer transaction right now.

The change improves the `fuel-core snapshot` command to accept the arguments, and you can either snap the whole state of the blockchain via the `everyone` command, or the state only of the contract. In the follow-up PRs we can snapping of the coins and messages too.

Optimizations:
- Use a lru cache to store the uncompressed data in the DB. The size is configurable via CLI `max-database-cache-size`.
- Added a `DryRun` execution type that skips the coinbase `Mint` transaction. In the future, we can skip some non-actual steps too.
- Updated the `PrometheusExtension` to not use the lock.
- Removed usage of the tracing extension in the graph QL because we have `PrometheusExtension` to gather the statistic about requests. https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1152 removes the honeycomb, so I didn't duplicate it here.
- Replaced the `tokio::task::spawn_blocking` + `Semaphore` by `tokio_rayon::spawn_fifo`.
- Replaced the concatenated `column_key` with the array for separate hash maps per column in the `MemoryStore` and `MemoryTransactionView`.
- Replaced the `Vec<u8>` in the KV API by the `Arc<Vec<u8>>`, because in most cases, we use it only for deserialization, and the memory database can continue to store the type. It helps reduce the number of clones.
- Used `BTreeMap` in the `MemoryStore`, because it allows to have a more optimized `iter_all` method. Without this change, a new e2e test fails with a timeout.
- Dry run doesn't wait for relayer anymore.

title: Update cargo audit and add to commit
body: Updates the audit to the latest version and also adds it to PRs

title: Release v0.17.11 final patch
body:
- Added a new e2e test that allows dry run any hex-encoded transaction.
- Simplified the `PrometheusExtension`.
- Use a new `fuel-vm 0.26.3` with disabled logging for `instruction` function.
- Use `tokio_rayon::spawn_fifo` to run dry runs instead of manual semaphore and `tokio::spawn_blocking`.
- Removed 5 second delay for dry runs caused by the relayer.

title: Rocksdb database optimisations
body: - Replaced combined `column_key` with an array of hash maps. - Added RocksDB LRU cache for uncompressed rows. It speeds up the loading of objects from the database two times. - Optimized the deserialization of the contracts via the `OptimizedContract` wrapper type. Instead of 53% now it takes only 10% of the time. - Replaced all values `Vec` with `Arc>` to avoid cloning because we use it only for deserialization, and we can't consume the actual `Vec`. It is helpful for `MemoryStore` and `MemoryTransactionView`. - Added a new e2e test for the contract with a large state. - Updated the `snapshot`command to do a snapshot only of the contract's state. - Updated the `MemoryStore` to use `BTreeMap` instead of `HashMap`. It significantly improved the performance of the `iter_all` without `RocksDB`. Without this optimization, a new e2e failed for `--no-default-features` build with a timeout(but worked with `RocksDB`).

title: pass swarm to manager
body:
Deals with https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1028#discussion_r1163074564

Pass the Punisher to PeerManager so it can deal with the banishment internally :)

title: Adding sentry data synchronization
body: See more details below

title: Capture metrics for graphql api
body:
closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1036

based on #1090, but completes the work and squashes into a single commit for easy cherry-picking

pulls in all changes from https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1114

title: fix the dry-run e2e test to actually perform dry runs
body:
For some reason the e2e test for dry-run's was actually running `transfer_back`, this corrects that to use the actual dry run test impl.

Also includes jemalloc in the e2e integration tests to more closely represent production.

title: default trait for handling from swarm events for children behaviours
body:
- cleans up the `on_swarm_event` method
- DRY since both Identity and Heartbeat just implement the default impl

does not decrease that much lines of code

title: use trait to convert network behaviour actions
body:
Attempt to partially address @freesig's comment about using a helper function: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1028#discussion_r1159275452

This extracts the conversion of network behaviour events out of the poll function and into separate functions.

title: use chainid for transactions and predicates
body:
Adapts fuel-core to changes in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/406

Routing the consensus parameters everywhere is a little painful, since we need to fetch the transaction ID so often. I've cleaned this up a little bit by introducing a new infallible api in [fuel-vm](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/419) to fetch the transaction id when it's known to be computed already. 

This could be cleaned up even further by using Checked\<Tx\> in more places, such as using `pub type CheckedBlock = Block<CheckedTransaction>` in the executor and consensus modules. But this would involve larger structural changes and optimizations to avoid rechecking transactions that have already been checked in the tx pool during sync, and should be done in a separate PR.

title: Upstream v0.17.8
body: Merges the changes from https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1096 upstream into master

title: Disable `dap` for the production `fuel-core-bin`
body:
It is a separate change from https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1096 to create an image without `jemallocator` not to mix fixes. 

Do not merge it. Maybe we will combine it with `jemallocator` for the release.

title: Use docker.io auth credentials to overcome rate limiting
body:
Occasionally our CI fails due to exceeding the docker.io rate limit. 

This PR adds an API token to our CI to increase our image pull limit.

title: Added e2e test to run 1000 `dry_run`
body: Reworked unit tests to execute the code directly without cmd.

title: chore: Update balance and state Merkleization
body:
Follow up on https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1008

Now that loading a Sparse Merkle tree checks for empty sum roots, we can simplify the usage at the client code level.

title: honeycomb tracing subscription
body: enable honeycomb tracing for fuel-core

title: Nginx tuneup
body:
- enables buffering of proxy responses
- increases client and response buffer sizes to 1mb to avoid frequent tmp file access / disk IO
- increase timeout from a default of 1m to 1h to avoid 504 timeouts

title: Support sticky session in the client
body:
Analog of the https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1078 for `master`

Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1076 and https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1074

title: Rust 1.68.1 & Sparse Registry
body: Upgrade to rust 1.68.1 and utilize the new sparse registry feature to speedup clean builds.

title: chore: Additional Tests for Contract States and Balances
body:
Related issues:
- Closes: #1064 

Additional tests to confirm that we create and remove Merkle metadata from the DB upon asset/state put and remove

title: Update withdrawal proof API to support proving from a block header committed to L1
body:
Close https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1046

Updated the code to use `fuel-vm 0.29`

title: Retrayable messages fuel-core part
body:
Fixes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/946 

This PR also uses the latest `fuel-vm` with https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/373.

- Updated the code to use named input types.
- Removed the usage of the `MessageId` from all places except the `BlockHeader` and related to the block stuff.
- Used `Nonce` as a primary key for messages instead of `MessageId`. Because of it, we don't need `CheckedMessage` anymore. Also, several tests failed because the nonce was the same.
- Updated the `Nonce` from `u64` to 32 bytes. Updated the ABI to use `uint256` instead of `uint64` - https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-v2-contracts/pull/35
- Renamed `Resources` into `Coins`. Renamed all comments and GraphQL API. Moved `coin.rs` and `resource.rs` into one `coins.rs`.
- Fixed some tests for https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/377 not to increase the `HP`.
- Removed usage of the `Output::Message`.
- Renamed `message_output_count` - > `message_receipt_count` and `message_output_root` -> `message_receipt_root`

And the main feature of why this change was created(implemented by several lines): 
`MessageData` aren't marked as spent unless included in a successfully executed script tx

title: fix yaml and add linting job
body: A recent PR broke the yaml indentation for the helm chart. This fixes that issue and adds a linting job to prevent further breakages from slipping past CI.

title: Support large contract deployments over p2p
body:
fixes: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1061

Increases the max_block_size to match the size limit of transactions

title: Actualized the ABI for message to be compatible with last version of the Solidity contracts.
Take into account the previous block timestamp during block production
body:
Updated the logic of the `PoA` to take into account the `last_timestamp` during block production. If the user manually specified the block with the future timestamp, the block production will use a new timestamp as a base to produce blocks.

Changed the API of the `produce_blocks` endpoint to accept only the start time and the number of blocks(The user can't specify the interval between blocks, it is defined by the `Trigger::Interval` mode).

Allowed enabling of the `manual_blocks_enabled` for the `Trigger::Interval` production mode.

title: Used `BASE_AMOUNT` for test with bob to pay for fee
Move out `peer_manager` from behaviour up to `p2p_service`
body:
In this _PR to PR_ I moved out our inner `peer_manager` logic from `PeerInfoBehaviour` to top of the p2p service, so that behaviour is not tasked with handling logic and decisions about peers, it just reports about peer events.

So I renamed previously named `PeerManagerBehaviour` to `PeerReportBehaviour`
and left `PeerManager` struct inside `peer_manager.rs` consequently this messes up the **diffs be warned**.

Although moving `peer_manager` up the stack cleaned up a lot of code and was a good decision, someone still had to poll `decay` and `health_check` intervals to inform p2p_service/peer_manager to perform the mentioned tasks, I had left those events inside `PeerReportBehaviour` as for now at least, until maybe we refactor some other parts and make it clearer where/who should perform the polling.

title: Prune owned coin idx when inputs are spent
body:
fixes: #1053

Remove owned coin index entries when coins are spent to improve the performance of random-improve based coin selection.

Already released v0.17.4 hotfix from this branch, ready to merge into mainline now.

title: Set tx pointer during block production
body:
closes: [#544](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/544)

- adds logic to the executor for setting / verifying tx_pointers
- adds tx pointer to chain config for coins and contracts
- adds utxo id to chain config for contracts

title: Fixed Tempfile dependency
body: `remove_dir_all` has a security advisory due to a race condition, which was a dependency of `tempfile`, and has been removed in `tempfile` `3.4`, so this just bumps the version to fix the security issue

title: Change sentry lb to use clusterIP
Add ingress service name to helm chart
use sticky sessions for GQL requests to sentries
body: since sentries might not be in perfect sync at any given moment, use sticky sessions when routing api requests

title: Added test to verify the iteration over owned transactions
body:
Added test to cover the iteration over owned transactions.

Ref https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1040

title: Adding specific app selector
body: Given we are now doing multiple sentries, we need to add a specific app selector that is common to fuel-core or sentry deployments, this is just an addition for it

title: adding fuel-core service monitor to helm chart
body: add fuel-core service monitor to helm chart

title: Bumped the version of the `fuel-core` and all crates to `0.17.3`
body:
## What's Changed
* RESERVED_NODES and BOOTSTRAP_NODES conditional by @rfuelsh in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1020
* barebones e2e test client by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1003
* Graceful Shutdown for all services by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1018
* Don't startup p2p or sync services if p2p isn't configured by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1021
* update to fuel-vm 0.26.1 by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1022
* Remove comment referencing previous defensive programming by @mitch-fuel in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1024
* Add RUST_LOG option to deployment charts & increase max_transmit_size by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1025
* additional integ tests for resources to spend by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1026
* Disable pagination args for balances by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1027
* Add e2e test to check that Bob can send money back to Alice by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1029
* Predicate error handling by @Voxelot in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1030
* Use composite actions by @tirkesi in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1032
* Pruning of the transaction by TTL by @xgreenx in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1033

## New Contributors
* @tirkesi made their first contribution in https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/1032

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/compare/v0.17.2...v0.17.3

title: Pruning of the transaction by TTL
body:
Added basic pruning of the transaction by the TTL.

It is done periodically for constant period of time. We can do it often(based on the remaining time to the next timeout), but I tried to avoid to often locking.

title: Use composite actions
body:
utilize notify slack and lint toml composite actions in ci.yml

test run: https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/actions/runs/4214220082

https://github.com/FuelLabs/.github/pull/2 needs to be merged first, since I changed the composite actions tags to point to master after running the test

title: Predicate error handling
body:
- Added tests to ensure errors like `PredicateExhaustedGas` are correctly returned by the txpool
- Removed duplicate predicate verification
- Removed async from tests that didn't need it
- Removed tests related to predicates being enabled or disabled since they are always enabled.

title: Add e2e test to check that Bob can send money back to Alice
body:
Added `transfer_back` test to check that Bob can receive money back from Alice.
Subscribed for `TxPool` instead of block importer.

title: peer reputation with separate app & gossipsub score
body:
The approach is mostly detailed in [Notion](https://www.notion.so/fuellabs/New-Proposal-96da9de6609b4faf94c30ae6bd355bc4).

These are the first steps of our Peer Reputation approach, there are certain _todos_ left, could be added later on or if needed I can add them with this PR.

Todo:
- [x] peer reputation decay with time
- [ ] implement unban peers after certain period
- [x] reserved peers should not be banned/scored ? - this is kind of "implemented" by only updating the score of non-reserved peers


Ref https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/943

title: Disable pagination args for balances
body:
Throw an error when attempting to use args like `before` and `after` for balance queries since they aren't used and are not currently supported.

Also updated the integ test for balances to setup assets for multiple owners to ensure the query is able to precisely select a particular owner.

title: additional integ tests for resources to spend
body: Adds integ tests to verify resources_to_spend doesn't select from any spent resources

title: Add RUST_LOG option to deployment charts & increase max_transmit_size
body:
- add rust_log option to deployment charts
- increase default max_transmit_size to match our load balancer limit

title: Remove comment referencing previous defensive programming
body: A recent change led to a collapsing of the block validation logic to check and compare the final block id instead of the transactions root and messages root separately beforehand. This check was redundant and thus this comment was relevant until @xgreenx recently simplified the checks.

title: update to fuel-vm 0.26.1
body: pulls in the changes from https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/355

title: Don't startup p2p or sync services if p2p isn't configured
body:
resolves: #1019

Disables p2p and sync services from starting if no peering key or network name is configured.

title: RESERVED_NODES and BOOTSTRAP_NODES conditional
body: we're passing empty env vars for RESERVED_NODES and BOOTSTRAP_NODES, we can either make those env vars conditional or I can make the CLI more tolerant of those env vars being set without values

title: Graceful Shutdown for all services
body:
- Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/949
- Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/897

Removed second spawned task for `fuel_core_services::service::run` function.

Instead, wrapped it into `catch_unwind`.
Added a `shutdown` method for the task that allows doing some cleanup for methods. For, almost, all services, it does nothing, but can be reused in the future. Added handling of the shutdown for `Relayer` to act immediately instead of waiting for the synchronization's end. Improved handling of the stop signal for `fuel-core-sync`.

title: attempt to use buildjet runners
bump to 0.17.2
Fix database version serialization
body:
The database version was being double initialized between `Database::init` and `RocksDB`. However, the `Database` was using postcard, and `RocksDB` was using manual byte serialization. This was causing version conflicts when restarting a fuel-core node off of an existing database, as the serialization methods were mismatched.

This PR resolves the issue by ensuring the database metadata is only managed by the database itself, and not by RocksDb.

This is a blocker for beta3.

title: Fixing merge conflicts
Prepare GraphQL Crate for extraction
body:
This PR works to simplify the `query` interfaces by extracting the logic from all `*contexts` into traits, then refactors all queries to fetch this information via type objects rather than directly through the database, which will allow a clean removal of the graphql crate, where the traits will move to, while the implementations for `Database` remain within `fuel-core`.

There are some small pointer annoyances such as `borrowed_box`, but this is unavoidable because `Database` is passed into the graphql context as a `Box`, and so whenever its accessed the pointer to it by default is `&Box<T>`, and so any function which requires erasing `Box<DatabasePort>` (which is aliased to `Database` with the graphql crate) to something like `Box<dyn MessageProofData>` will inevitable create a borrowed box and so clippy will complain, but this can't really be avoided due to the graphql structure

title: fuel-core #997 and #1006- sentry lb enabled and resources
body:
- fuel-core #997: [multiple sentry deployment via helm#997](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/997)
- fuel-core #1006 [Add resources to fuel-core#1006](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/1006)

title: re-revert optimistic peer reconnect
body: @xgreenx was right, we already do the peer reconnect on on [PeerDisconnect](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/blob/master/crates/services/p2p/src/peer_manager.rs#L72)

title: feat: Contract state and assets merkle data storage
body:
Related PRs:
- Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/626
- Closes https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/627

This PR calculates SMT roots for a contract's state and balances. Both states and balances are modified via random-access inserts and deletes, so roots must be calculated as an SMT on top of a sparse key-value dataset. 

Additionally, this PR modifies the root calculations and related tests to use the correct empty root, the 32 byte 0, rather than the hash of the empty string. The 32 byte 0 is the default for SMTs while the hash of the empty string is the default for BMTs.

title: 0.17.1 release patch
body: Includes the bug fix for rocksdb prefix seeking

title: Bugfix: set prefix extractor for all columns that need it
body:
The bug caused by https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/pull/976

- Fixes column settings for all APIs that seek using a prefix
- Enables rocksdb in integration_tests when using default features
- Disables backwards pagination for APIs where a prefix is used, as rocksdb doesn't support it

title: barebones e2e test client
body:
This adds a new publishable binary to fuel-core that allows for e2e testing against deployed environments. Ideally tests added here should be relatively lightweight, tolerate concurrency and make minimal assumptions about the state of the network before executing.

Currently the test only performs a basic transfer, but the suite should be expanded to cover other common use-cases like contract deployments.

The main binary uses libtest-mimic to make it compatible with most cargo test runner plugins (e.g. nextest) or common IDE patterns for debugging tests.

It is driven by a configuration tomlfile which allows endpoints and wallet secrets to be configured based on the environment being tested. This is described more in the README.md.

helps unblock https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core/issues/482 and https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-k8s-operator/issues/26

title: fix p2p `max_peers_connected_works` test
body:
We've been having certain issues with this test especially in the CI,
here's the analysis and the fix.

First problem is the assertion put on the swarm itself instead of our PeerManager:
```rust
if p2p_service.swarm.connected_peers().count() > peer_limit { panic!() }
```
While generally this should not return more peers than allowed, one of the reasons we have PeerManager is to actually contain number of peers connected logic, so moving the assertion to
```rust
if p2p_service.peer_manager().total_peers_connected() > peer_limit { panic!() }
```
should suffice since PeerManager is the one disconnecting surplus peers.

Other, and bigger, issue with the test was the amount of simulated nodes we used in our example.
Having 100+ nodes running makes the test itself unnecessarily slow.
This became even more evident now that we made our Heartbeat protocol ask for a disconnect from a node that did not reply within 2 seconds with a Block Height. So nodes started disconnecting from each other and the test would never hit its exit point.

Actually there is no need to have that amount of nodes, instead same assertion can be achieved with a smaller amount, so I have decreased the amount of nodes in the test.

title: Publish fix
body: needed to update the helm chart version verification script to utilize the new workspace feature

title: avoid compiling unused deps when --no-default-features is used
body: speedup builds using `--no-default-features` by disabling extra deps that aren't used

title: bump versions to 0.17.0
make heartbeat config fields configurable and expose them to CLI
body: currently our Block heartbeat config fields were hardcoded, this PR makes them configurable and exposes them in the CLI

title: revert optimistic reserved node reconnect

labels.name: tech-debt
labels.description: The issue is to improve the current code and make it more clear/generic/reusable/pretty/avoidable.

body:
During #974 optimistic reconnect was removed from the code as being a _duplicate_ work.

It was not a duplicate work, more of an optimistic immediate reconnect if the node is available, while `health_check` tries to reconnect after a certain Interval (e.g. 30-60 seconds) which is there as a backup only if the optimistic reconnect was not successful.

I also added a small description comment to `OutboundState`.

title: Write contract code in raw
body: replaces #796

title: avoid pulling protoc via github api
body: use `sudo apt-get` to fetch protoc instead of downloading the binary from github to avoid rate limiting

title: Don't capture signals within lib
body: closes #980

title: Stop the `ServiceRunner` if it is not used
add helpful error message to opening rocksdb
body: show directions from [readme](https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-core#outdated-database) in error context during opening of rocksdb.

title: Ignore unpublish changes on standard publish verification
body: Ignore unpublished changes when simulating publishing on master / PR CI.

title: Avoid feature unification during testing of --no-default-features
body: our --no-default-features testing wasn't working as expected due to feature unification. This change ensures each crate is tested in isolation with no extra features enabled.

title: make in-memory iteration match rocksdb behavior
body:
fixes bug introduced in #643 

this bug can be demonstrated on master by running all tests with `--no-default-features`

actually this bug might've existed earlier, we just didn't notice it due to feature unification

title: fix(client): feature-gate tx subscription for WASM
body:
To allow `fuels-types` to use `fuel-core-client` on WASM (and unblock the Indexer team), usage of `eventsource-client` (which uses TCP, sockets etc.) needs to be feature-gated while I'm working on bringing the subscription functionality to WASM.

This should be merged before #446, as it still needs to be completed and is of much lesser priority.

title: replace usage of futures-timer to avoid extra helper threads
body: futures-timer was being used in p2p, however it makes use of helper threads which are unnecessary since we use a tokio runtime.

Update fuel-vm 0.25.3
Some improvements during work with the database

Each point of the issue is made as a separate commit, so it may be simpler to review each commit.

Simplify BMT push error
body:
Follow up to https://github.com/FuelLabs/fuel-vm/pull/328.

Now that `push` returns `StorageError` rather than `MerkleTree<StorageError>` we no longer need to map the error to `Other`.

title: Fix for CI to publish
body:
Fixed CI to publish. Added additional job before publishing to verify that publishing will be successful.
Added instructions on how to verify publishing

title: added a comma value delimiter for clap arguments
body:
some of our CLI arguments require array of values, we had issues parsing them, adding a comma delimiter helps in parsing the values like:

```bash
RESERVED_NODES="/dns4/my-fuel-sentry-0/tcp/30333/p2p/16Uiu2HAmKTu2oFwqhcRQ9fyyCy5bh5vReh8nWfbZRQ991MzEVwWw,/dns4/my-fuel-sentry-1/tcp/30333/p2p/16Uiu2HAmLFKkEYZFE86JZszmoMTCw4XJF7P4jxoDG7RJgtKV8ZNN"
```
